bboxes.raw_text:
PURCHASE, MY. Cited as
leader, patriot and man OF
faith" Roy Wilkins, executive
director of the National Asso-
citation for the Advancement of
Colored People, was the recip-
lent of an honorary Doctor of
Laws degree conferred upon him
by the Manhattanville College
of the Sacred Heart, a Catholic
women S school here.


Adre ssing the college convo-
cation, on Oct. 20, MIR. Wilkins
commended the young people of
the country for their rejection
of the sophistry' which holds
that Federal law should not be
invoked to protect Americans in
pursuit of their basic citizen
ship rights.

"The youth of our land, in
overwhelming numbers -. sees
freedom as freedom, not S white
or black or North or South free
DOM" he told the young women
of Manhattanville College.


Youth which has seen govern
ment used in Miss issippi "aS
an instrument of oppression"
rejects the contention "that gov
eminent must not assume, affir-
matively, the task of protecting
and projecting individual free
dom for mankind"


The NAACP leader lauded the
role of youth in Working for
better world through participa-
tion in the Peace Corps, the
Mississippi summer project and
in other efforts to give meaning
to the concept of democracy.

TOKYO Edith MCGUIRE, ia st
track star, a negro student at
Tenne ssee State, was one of the
few women to win a gold medal in
recent Olympic competition.


She was first carrying u. S.
colors in the 200 meter race.


Her schoolmate Wyomia Tyus
came home first in the 100 meter
race.


Miss MCGUIRE was close
second in the 100 meter da sh and
she was awarded a silver medal.


Florida's Bob Hayes, called
the world s ia stest human asily
won the men S 100 meter da sh in
10 seconds. He set a record.


Hayes Jones, Detroit. Michi-
gan schoolteacher, started last
but won a gold medal in the ITO
meter hurdles. His time was
1879.

Postma ster w. ]. Ma son an
nounced Phoenix mailmen will
soon carry a pressurized con-
tainer of dog repellent. The
Humane Society of the United
States, The American Humane
Association, and the American
Kennel Club have raised no OBJ
jections to its use.


The repellent has been &C
cepted and registered by the u.
S. Department of Agriculture,
Pesticides Regulations Branch,
and has also been registered in
all states requiring such regis
tration. The significance of these
regi strations is that they identify
the product s effective and safe.


A misture of cayenne pepper
and mineral oil will be sprayed
on the attacking animal. The dog
will retreat without a whimper,
and the effects of the repellent
will wear off in Is to 20 minutes,
with no after effects.


The use of the repellent does
not replace the policy of nom
delivery of mail where there
is dog menace.

During the past SIX years Of Republican
0d77ainiStyu at the exe cattiUe position in
Arizona much progress has been made.


We haze realized a gYoa0th in business and
industrial development, an increase in state
Wide services, a well promoted and enlarged
state fair program, more Jobs opening and
progressive border policy with Mexico.


We can rest assured that Richard Dick
KleindienSt will keep his program ge0Ted to
continued progress, Development and improve
ment.


Kleindienst is an able attorney, aOh0 grew
ub in the state. He has worked closely Vith
governmental and CHIC groups for many years.
He has served the Republican Party at a local
level and state level with high acclaim.


HIS proposals for the creation OF a state
budget and finance division would put Arizona
on a sound economic basis. Presently, AM
zomo is not keeping step with the other states
sOho haze realized the need for establishing
a state budget0Yt department. This 100uId
eliminate the aOasteta4l purchasing, accounting
and storing by twenty or more state agencies
and offices.

The Lennon Sisters, Kathy, FL,
Peggy, % and Janet, ID. will
appear the first five days of the
Arizona State Fair. Nov. oil.


Other stars of the Lawrence
Welk Show joining them will be
Barbara Boylan and Bobby Bur-
CESS, the teenage dancing team,
and Jack Incl, the dancer and
marimba artist.


Freddy Morgan, the banjo play
ing comedian who appeared on the
Spike Jones Show for eight years,
is an added attraction.


Mel and Clora Bryant, bro
Their and sister team, will COM
bine comedy and music. Mel
sings and gives comic material
as Clora plays the trumpet. They
recently completed an l8 week
run in Las Vegas.


Henrys Chimps. we'll known
television performers, will add
to the fun at the fair.


A total of l56 separate acts,
performing daily on three stages
and ~ bands will make the 1864
Arizona State Fair crowd plea
ser,

Tv Trio
TO Be At Fair

Many Vaeytes reception honoring William Mahoney
Ghana Sunday. held at the home of
Mrs. William Warren, 5216 S. 10th Place.
From left front and Mrs. William Warren Mrs. Herbert
Finn Mr. and Mrs. ones Mrs. Curtis O. Greenfield
reception sponsored Broadway Councils
oere who have devoted several promoting
recreatonal program the southside.

Mr.. and Mrs. Ebert Williams
1888 E. Wa shington.
Standing left Mrs. Jimmie Saunders president and
Der; Theresa, Mrs. Alvin Richie, her SPONSOR
will provide Christmas
ba skets for underprveged families.

Members of Delta Beta Omega Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority
seed The Sickle Cell Story depicting unusual blood disease
which affects mainly Negroes the public library auditorium Sun
day, Oct. IS


A premiere showing of slide presentation given

Phillips ba seus Clarence Laing NJ De- consulant
Mesdames Alice Marriott, Lote Wyatt Ann Taylor.

Alpha Chi P Omega sorority local chapter held its annual Mary
Founders Day the Eks Lodge Sunday Oct 25


who projects raise scholarship
Goodman College, Datona Beach, Fla whchwas
by Mrs. Bethune, pioneer Negro leader.

Campbell Laveta Brooks Maple Lebera Ray Laea

MCGEE.
